description.en: Two AI 'brains' (CLIP and T5) each read your text â€” the slider pushes the image far beyond what either would normally produce, into unexplored territory where surreal, dreamlike compositions emerge.

context.en: The Surrealizer encodes your prompt separately through CLIP-L (visual encoder, 77 tokens, 768 dims padded to 4096) and T5-XXL (language encoder, 512 tokens, 4096 dims). First 77 tokens: (1-Î±)Â·CLIP-L + Î±Â·T5. Positive Î± extrapolates past T5 into linguistically driven hallucinations. Negative Î± amplifies CLIP-L and negates T5 â€” critically, the upper 3328 dimensions (where CLIP-L is zero-padded) receive inverted T5 vectors, flipping cross-attention patterns in the transformer and producing visually driven hallucinations with disrupted semantics. Remaining T5 tokens (78-512) unchanged as semantic anchor. Stage 2 skipped to preserve original prompt.

Erste 77 Tokens: (1-Î±)Â·CLIP-L + Î±Â·T5. Positives Î± extrapoliert Ã¼ber T5 hinaus â†’ sprachlich getriebene Halluzinationen. Negatives Î± verstÃ¤rkt CLIP-L und negiert T5 â€” entscheidend: In den oberen 3328 Dimensionen (CLIP-L dort nur Nullen) entstehen invertierte T5-Vektoren, die Cross-Attention-Muster im Transformer umkehren â†’ visuell getriebene Halluzinationen mit gestÃ¶rter Semantik. Restliche T5-Tokens (78-512) unverÃ¤ndert als semantischer Anker. Stage 2 wird Ã¼bersprungen, um den Original-Prompt zu erhalten.
